subject: Re: Something interesting ...
author: Fiona Broome
full_text:
Hi,

Zack, that's very cool!

I have over 30 years' experience as a genealogist. (Yes, it's another of my many hats.)  For years, I've been the behind-the-scenes go-to person for professional genealogists to reach a dead end... no pun intended.

So, if I can help you located the 150-year-old record, let me know. I'd be happy to see what I can, um, dig up.  

If I can contribute that kind of research to this work, I'm delighted!

Cheerfully,
Fiona

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:
>
> That's all fascinating. It makes sense to me.
> 
> I have gotten several EVP recordings in which a name was given. In all cases
> the name is not a name that was known by any of the living people present
> and there is no particular reason for anyone there to be thinking of that
> name. In one case the name was verified in old records as a person present
> in that location many years ago (but we certainly didn't know that at the
> time we were there). In another case we're still trying to find out if
> anyone by that name was in that area within the last 150 years.
> Zack
>
